result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heriberto A Pineda

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Judicial Rotation and Case Assignment Plan effective 4/1/17
cc: DA(efile), Defendant, Surety and Bookkeeping by COC on 1/3/17. sf

[MK] case called at 1:03pm. 
Defendant Heriberto A Pineda not in court.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the court record which includes information from Attorney Wineke that Mr. Pineda has been removed from the US by the Immigration Service.
The Court orders the cash bond forfeiture in finality, based on the non-appearnace of Mr. Pineda and any surety who may have posted the cash bond amount. The clerk shall distribute the funds to the General Fund. 
recess 1:05pm.
JA's Response to 11-11-16 RUMS
Granting Attorney Wineke's request to appear by telephone for the 11-3-16 Status Conference

[MK] case called at 10:35am. 
Attorney Annamarie A Wineke appears by telephone.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 
Attorney Wineke reports that she has had no contact with Defendant Heriberto Pineda since the June hearing when Mr. Pineda telephoned in to say that he had been deported; so she assumes that the status remains the same.
The Court issues a Bench Warrant. 
The Court finds the Bond to be in default and orders it forfeited.
The Court removes the appointment of Attorney Wineke as counsel for Mr. Pineda; she may submit her final billing.
recess 10:36am.
from Attorney Wineke requesting to appear by phone for the Status Conference on 11-3-2016 at 10:30am
JA's review of RUMS
Status conference on November 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Court rescinds order for reimbursement of Attorney fees and pay plan. Court's best information is that defendant has been removed from the USA
FINANCIAL: from Bkpg to Judge; Re: Failure to Comply with Court Order to make Attorney Fees Trust payments.

Case called at 2:06 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for intial appearance)
Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Heriberto A Pineda not in court. 
Atty Wineke informs the Court that she has had no communication with Mr. Pineda
Court reviews case file documents indicating that bond has been previously set in this matter
Defendant Heriberto A Pineda now appears via telephone: 2:09 pm
Mr. Pineda informs the Court that he was deported one week ago from the US
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Pineda informs the Court that he was informed that it would be illegal to re-enter the Country.
ADA Shock requests warrant, presents basis
Court denies State's request for issuance of warrant, presents basis
Court continues bond, if Mr. Pineda does appear in Wisconsin, can be taken into custody on probable cause
Court enters Not Guilty plea on Mr. Pineda's behalf which starts the clock running
Court will have matter pend on day to day basis upon further motion from either the State or Defense. 
Court continues the appointment of Atty Wineke
Recess: 2:18 pm

NEXT: JA TICKLE FILE IN 3 MONTHS
Initial appearance on June 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Attorney Annamarie Wineke

This Petition is Granted because the Court finds the person is currently indigent. An attorney shall be appointed at county expense as set forth below. The person shall be required to reimburse the county for such representation as follows:

Repayment at the rate of $100 per month until the sum is paid.

Case called at 4:13pm [mo]
Defendant Heriberto A Pineda in court.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews documents submitted, including Petition for Court appointed counsel
THe Court grants the Petition for Court appointed counsel.
The Court orders Mr. Pineda to makes payments in the amount of $100 per month beginning 5/20/16 and on the 20th of every month thereafter until paid in full

The Court maintains the $500 cash bond on file.
The Court adds the conditions:
--no discussion of the case with Laura Martinez
--no acts or threats of violence
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess: 4:18pm


NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 5/24/16 at 2:00pm

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

[MK] case called at 11:28am. 
Defendant Heriberto A Pineda not in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock  appears for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of ADA Shock, the Court finds the cash bail in default and the Court issues a Warrant.   The Court indicates that if Mr. Pineda is arrested then the Initial Apearance would be scheduled before Judge Wambach, however if Mr. Pineda is brought before this Court for Bail-purposes, then the Court would see him.
recess 11:30am.
Copy of criminal complaint
Initial appearance on April 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
